subject: Business
title: Nostalgia Marketing
description: A micro-lesson that makes Nostalgia Marketing usable.

hook.text: Nintendo re-released the NES Classic. It sold out instantly. People paid $300 for $30 of 1985 technology.

buildup.text: Nostalgia marketing taps into warm memories of the past to create emotional bonds with products.

discovery.text: Research shows nostalgia increases willingness to pay. It makes people feel socially connected and optimistic.

twist.text: The memory doesn't need to be accurate. We romanticize the past. The product just needs to trigger the feeling.

climax.text: Stranger Things revived 1980s brands overnight. Eggo waffle sales spiked simply from appearing on screen.

punchline.text: You're not selling the past. You're selling how the past made them feel.

quiz.question: Why does nostalgia marketing increase willingness to pay?
options: It triggers warm feelings of social connection and optimism
Older products are always better made
People feel guilty about forgetting the past
